p: It was pointed out by Pavlath, et al. [ 69] that two type of reactions take place when an alginate film/coating is immersed in crosslinking calcium solution: diffusion of the multivalent ion which induces formation of calcium linkage with the carboxyl groups for the insolubilization of the alginate film, and the dissolution of alginate by the solution [ 58]. The increased concentration of the multivalent ion diminishes the dominance of the dissolution process [ 69]. Rhim [ 70] also noticed the same phenomena and added that the method of CaCl 2 treatment affected the thickness of the film, i.e., direct addition of the crosslinking agent lead to thicker films compared to immersing the alginate films into a crosslinking solution.
